meanings.sent1: The daud of thunder scared the little dog.
meanings.sent2: The car made a daud as it drove over the pothole.
meanings.sent3: The daud of the slamming door made everyone jump.
meanings.sent4: The daud of the fireworks filled the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The daud of the alarm clock woke me up abruptly.

meanings.definition: To hit or strike with force.
meanings.sent1: He dauds the nail into the wall with a hammer.
meanings.sent2: She dauds the ball with all her might during the game.
meanings.sent3: The chef dauds the dough to make it flat for the pizza.
meanings.sent4: The waves daud against the rocks, eroding them slowly.
meanings.sent5: The boxer dauds his opponent with a powerful punch.

meanings.sent1: The daud from the tree branch hitting the window startled us.
meanings.sent2: The daud of the hammer hitting the nail echoed in the room.
meanings.sent3: The daud of the basketball hitting the hoop signaled a score.
meanings.sent4: The daud of the gavel silenced the courtroom.
meanings.sent5: The daud of the falling tree branch shook the ground.
